required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pulmonary Diffusing Capacity During Postural Postural Changes and Acute Exercise
clinical_study.official_title: Pulmonary Diffusing Capacity Changes to Posture and Acute Exercise in Healthy Volunteers: a Randomised Test-retest Relaibility Study

brief_summary.textblock: The combined measurement of the pulmonary diffusing capacity to carbon monoxide (CO) and nitric oxide (NO) (DLCO/NO) has recently been standardised and validated for clinical use. It involves a very short breath-hold time (≤5 seconds), and it may be repeated up to 12 times without affecting measurements, and it is thus ideal for assessing acute changes in pulmonary diffusing capacity and its components during various physiological manoeuvres. The aim of the present study is to compare the test-retest reliability of pulmonary diffusing capacity measurements during postural changes (sitting vs. supine) vs. rest-to-exercise. DLCO/NO will either be measured in the sitting position during rest vs. exercise or in the sitting and supine posture, and this will be repeated within 1-7 days in 20 healthy individuals that will be randomised to one of the two interventions. Statistically,the test-retest relaibility of sitting-to-supine vs. rest-to-exercise changes in DLCO/NO will be compared by parametric methods.

primary_outcome.description: Test-retest reliability coefficient of rest-to-exercise and supine-to-prone DLNO/DLCO-ratio
Test-retest repeatability coefficient of rest-to-exercise and supine-to-prone DLCO
Test-retest repeatability coefficient of rest-to-exercise and supine-to-prone DLNO

secondary_outcome.description: Test-retest repeatability coefficient of rest-to-exercise and supine-to-prone DM
Test-retest repeatability coefficient of rest-to-exercise and supine-to-prone Vc

other_outcome.description: Between-day repeatability coefficient of DLNO/DLCO at rest in both groups combined

clinical_study.condition: Clinical Assessments of Pulmonary Diffusing Capacity

intervention.description: Pulmonary diffusing capacity is assessed at rest and during exercise (70% of VO2max on a bicycle ergometer)
Pulmonary diffusing capacity is assessed in the sitting and supine position

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
• Regular exercise (1-3 timer per week)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any known medical condition that requires regular medication or any known lung condition
- Smoking
- Symptoms of disease within 2 weeks prior to the study
- Abnormal lung function test
- Pregnancy

patient_data.ipd_description: Data will be shared upon reasonable request.
